channel.title: Loss of passion for programming
channel.description:
So I'm having a bit of a problem. I feel like I've lost my passion for programming. I've been programming for 6+ hours a day since mid-2007, and I'm just burned out. And it's not like I don't have all of these things to program, I just lack the knowledge to program them, and when all of my projects bring me to that point, it just starts to build up. I'm not at the point where I want to program, because it's what I like to do, but I don't want to because to complete the projects I need to understand things that I've tried to understand and simply cant.
Has anyone else experienced this, and if so what did you do to get over it?

item.title: Loss of passion for programming
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

[quote=“imsuperman05, post:48, topic:433548”]Is ytuio9 from Ireland? That’d prob explain it.

I didn’t know that though.[/quote]

American English isn’t as widely adopted in countries that were former British colonies. Since Egypt is a former British colony, and was taken over after the US gained independence and started developing it’s own changes to the language, it is likely English spelling is more prominent over American English in Egypt, though I’m not sure on that. But it would make sense given how many other countries that seem to use English over American English spelling, or sometimes a hybrid that leans a bit more towards English.

Read full topic

item.title: Loss of passion for programming
item.dc:creator: @Svitkona Svitkona
item.description:
@Svitkona wrote:

Funny because that’s the impression all tourists get of Egypt too

It’s sad because it’s beautiful and apparently it has potential for a lot of money-making (I heard that the Suez canal alone makes a lot of money, not verified though), but nobody is actually tapping that potential. Iirc it’s been going downhill for the last ~200 years. It sort of annoys you when you look around you and see people that have money but use it on worthless things instead of trying to advance their knowledge or something. I heard it’s like that around the whole world too, but it just depresses you when you see it happening in your country

Read full topic

item.title: Loss of passion for programming
item.dc:creator: @chillwitm888 chillwitm888
item.description:
@chillwitm888 wrote:

[quote=“imsuperman05, post:48, topic:433548”][quote author=Si Force link=topic=536268.msg3928627#msg3928627 date=1330466783]

@ytu
Yes, its logical. I find remembering all the rules confusing… Creativity I could say is easy so by that logic don’t even start. Maths is hard FOR ME and in britain anyways MANY people find it hard. This is a programming community so i’d expect some people to post retarded things. Not going to read anymore of your post, its trash.

If you don’t agree with his post, take it up through the PM system. We don’t want to see flame/spam on the thread.

@ytu
Yes, its logical. I find remembering all the rules confusing… Creativity I could say is easy so by that logic don’t even start. Maths is hard FOR ME and in britain anyways MANY people find it hard. This is a programming community so i’d expect some people to post retarded things. Not going to read anymore of your post, its trash.

It’s pronounced “Math”, not “Maths.” Your second to last sentence barely made sense.

Actually, ‘Math’ is the American way of saying it. Different countries say it different ways. In Ireland we say ‘Maths’.
[/quote]
Is ytuio9 from Ireland? That’d prob explain it.

I didn’t know that though.[/quote]
There is a probability other countries also say Maths

Read full topic

item.title: Loss of passion for programming
item.dc:creator: @Daginith Daginith
item.description:
@Daginith wrote:

[quote=“Loveandpower, post:41, topic:433548”][quote author=Daginith link=topic=536268.msg3923335#msg3923335 date=1329948737]
Try learning the language LISP. Its not formatted like any other language…

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lisp_(programming_language)
[/quote]ew if he wants a real challenge learn rpg[/quote]
I shit my pants :3

  Historically RPG is columnar in nature, though free-formatting      * is allowed under particular circumstances.      * The purpose of various lines code are determined by a      * letter code in column 6.      * An asterisk (*) in column 7 denotes a comment line      * "F" (file) specs define files and other i/o devices     F ARMstF1   IF   E       K     Disk    Rename(ARMST:RARMST)            * "D" specs are used to define variables     D pCusNo          S              6p 0     D pName           S             30a     D pAddr1          S             30a     D pAddr2          S             30a     D pCity           S             25a     D pState          S              2a     D pZip            S             10a      * "C" (calculation) specs are used for executable statements      * Parameters are defined using plist and parm opcodes     C     *entry        plist     C                   parm                    pCusNo     C                   parm                    pName     C                   parm                    pAddr1     C                   parm                    pAddr2     C                   parm                    pCity     C                   parm                    pState     C                   parm                    pZip      * The "chain" command is used for random access of a keyed file     C     pCusNo        chain     ARMstF1      * If a record is found, move fields from the file into parameters     C                   if        %found     C                   eval      pName  = ARNm01     C                   eval      pAddr1 = ARAd01     C                   eval      pAddr2 = ARAd02     C                   eval      pCity  = ARCy01     C                   eval      pState = ARSt01     C                   eval      pZip   = ARZp15     C                   endif      * RPG makes use of switches.  One switch "LR" originally stood for "last record"      * LR actually flags the program and its dataspace as removable from memory.     C                   eval      *InLR = *On

item.dc:creator: @Kidpaparoach Kidpaparoach
item.description:
@Kidpaparoach wrote:

[quote=“imsuperman05, post:37, topic:433548”][quote author=Kidpaparoach link=topic=536268.msg3923233#msg3923233 date=1329943264]
@ytu
Yes, its logical. I find remembering all the rules confusing… Creativity I could say is easy so by that logic don’t even start. Maths is hard FOR ME and in britain anyways MANY people find it hard. This is a programming community so i’d expect some people to post retarded things. Not going to read anymore of your post, its trash.
[/quote]
It’s pronounced “Math”, not “Maths.” Your second to last sentence barely made sense.[/quote]
I know but I’m not making an effort to type properly, you’ve seen my other posts and we both know that you know I don’t try and type to my best; I type fast. Also, I say maths irl and I generally type how I talk but I remove most if not all the slang I use so that people from different countries can understand what I’m saying. Yeah, because I changed my mind about what I wanted to say but decided not to even give him the effort of deleting the previous part of what I had typed.
